feed.title: Trend Business and Market
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Global Game Changer: Alibaba's David Beckham Partnership
entry.summary: In recent news, Alibaba's global arm has announced the signing of David Beckham as their international e-commerce brand ambassador. This move comes as Alibaba aims for global expansion and seeks to strengthen its presence in the international market. In another development, there has been a significant decrease of 38% in the new supply of homes across the top eight cities in India, with each home costing â‚¹60 lakh, during the period of January to March. This information has been reported by PropEquity. Shifting gears, there is speculation surrounding Duolingo's stock, with some suggesting that it may outperform the S&P 500 within a year. Meanwhile, residents of Mumbai can look forward to easier travel as the Aarey-BKC Metro Line is expected to open in July, providing much-needed relief from the city's congested transportation system. In the world of finance, Elon Musk's xAI has successfully raised $6 billion in fresh funding from investors such as Fidelity and Sequoia Capital. On a different note, Switzerland's Central Bank has made some interesting investment decisions, selling Apple stock while purchasing shares of Virgin Galactic. In other news, Yeida, a development authority in India, is set to acquire 6,000 hectares of land for urban development, as reported by Hindustan Times. Lastly, China, Japan, and South Korea have pledged to work towards progress on a Free Trade Agreement (FTA), highlighting their commitment to regional economic cooperation. Additionally, Sundaram Finance has released its Q4 results, showing robust growth in assets under management (AUM) and improved asset quality, according to IDBI Capital's review.
